title: Monthly consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in India July 2019
summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
Over the 6 Months, the Consumer price index for both Rural and Urban have climbed.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index for Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index for Month January.
There is a gap of 26.0 between the highest and lowest Consumer price index found for Rural in Month June and February.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, its value throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Rural and Urban. In both cases, the Consumer price index have climbed.
mid_summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
Over the 6 Months, the Consumer price index for both Rural and Urban have climbed.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index for Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index for Month January.
There is a gap of 26.0 between the highest and lowest Consumer price index found for Rural in Month June and February.
max_summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Rural and Urban. In both cases, the Consumer price index have climbed.
For Month June, Rural had the highest Consumer price index 1436.0 among the 3 groups and in January, Urban had the lowest Consumer price index 1380.0.
Among all the Months, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and lowest Consumer price index in Month February.
Month June and February had the biggest gap of 26.0 between the highest and lowest Consumer price index found for Rural.
Among the groups, Urban had the biggest difference in Consumer price index. Where the maximum Consumer price index was 1.03 times larger than the minimum Consumer price index.
Rural had the maximum Consumer price index out of all 3 groups in Month June followed by Rural in June, and the minimum Consumer price index is found for Urban in January.
Averaging all 3 groups All India, Urban, and Rural, the Month June is the maximum Consumer price index and January is the minimum Consumer price index.
